originalText.text: What a great experience! The food was so delicious and not your traditional sushi that's for sure!! The flavor 10 out if 10! The staff also was so pleasant and very helpful with helping me decide on what to eat! Highly suggest dining in for a luxury sushi experience. (I want to say my waiters name was Anthony. Amazing customer service üëè) The host on my visit was also friendly and attentive.

originalText.text: Server Anthony walked us through all the individual pieces and orders. Sushi was phenomenal, small delicate and with great flavors on beautiful serving sets. Tuna tartar was so tasty and different than any I have ever had. Ice cream sandwich was an amazing final touch.

text.text: Server Anthony walked us through all the individual pieces and orders. Sushi was phenomenal, small delicate and with great flavors on beautiful serving sets. Tuna tartar was so tasty and different than any I have ever had. Ice cream sandwich was an amazing final touch.

originalText.text:
This was my first time here. Overall good experience. Everything was fresh and presentable. I sat at the bar since I was alone.
Cons: I was feeling rushed upon arrival. Within 2 min of looking at the menu I was approached twice with question if I‚Äôm ready to order which was clear I didn‚Äôt. Then I was asked if I have any questions about menu and then I said yes the waitress was not able to answer. Also I showed her the pic from Google review to find out the name of the dish and she was not able to tell me what it was (it was recent pic). She than asked about allergies which I told her I don‚Äôt have any and 30 seconds later she asked again the same question. So it was weird. Cook was preparing sushi right in front of me so I asked his a question what kind of fish it was. He answered first time but than called the waitress which than anyway asked him the same question cause she didn‚Äôt know the answer.
Now the sushi experience. I liked everything. Fish was good and fresh, seaweed crispy which I liked especially. The only sushi I didn‚Äôt like was salmon row. Which had weird taste and was too ‚Äúmushy‚Äù. The row and rice just all fell through the bottom, it was a mess.
Miso soup was really good. Not salty like they usually serve which was nice. I also really like the salmon sushi with some sourness and crispy stuff on top. I agree with comments above that it could have a bit less rice but still tasted great. Will be back.

Miso soup was really good. Not salty like they usually serve which was nice. I also really like the salmon sushi with some sourness and crispy stuff on top. I agree with comments above that it could have a bit less rice but still tasted great. Will be back.

originalText.text: My sister and I stopped in for Sunday afternoon lunch today. The atmosphere is clean and the food was pretty good but my complaint is with the way our server rushed us through our meal. Constantly interrupting the flow of our conversation to ask if we‚Äôre ready to order even though we were still looking through the menu.  We barely put the chopsticks down when our server rushed in to clear our dishes, or ask if we wanted to order something else or pay the bill. Since the restaurant was pretty empty at this time, it was quite annoying and made us feel unwanted; especially when other customers who were there longer got to chat and amble in peace.

originalText.text:
Cute location with bright decors, good for dates because it is nice and quiet.

The salmon don was really good, the salmon is slightly torched but still mostly raw. It is a little pricey since there‚Äôs very few slices of salmon but it was overall good.

The scallops temaki was just average.
